title: Understand the Function
text: This function is $$f(x)=\sqrt{7-x}$$. The function uses a square root, which means it can only take numbers resulting in non-negative values inside the square root. Let's explore this to understand the domain.

title: What is Domain?
text: The domain of a function is the set of all possible input values $$(x-values)$$ that will not make the function undefined.

title: Square Root Basics
text: Remember that you can't take the square root of a negative number and get a real number result. This means the expression inside the square root must be zero or positive.

title: Finding Domain Inequality
text: Set the inside of the square root to be greater than or equal to zero: $$7-x \geq 0$$. Solving this inequality will help us find the domain.

title: Solving the Inequality
text: Solve the inequality $$7-x \geq 0$$ to find $$x$$. Rearrange the inequality to find the possible x-values.

title: How to Solve the Inequality
text: Add $$x$$ to both sides to get $$7 \geq x$$. This can also be rewritten as $$x \leq 7$$. This means $$x$$ can be any number less than or equal to $$7$$.

title: Domain in Interval Notation
text: Now that you know $$x \leq 7$$, we can express this range of values as an interval, which is the domain of the function.

title: Express Domain as Interval
text: Use the result of the inequality to write the domain in interval notation: $$(-\infty,7]$$.
